The question is asking which option is more likely. To answer this, we need to focus solely on the probabilistic models and ignore the extraneous background information.

Option (a) states that the protagonist would likely develop software programs that address user-specific issues.

Option (b) states that the protagonist would likely develop software programs that address user-specific issues to play classical music.

From a probabilistic perspective, option (a) is a single event, whereas option (b) is a conjunction of two events: developing software programs that address user-specific issues AND playing classical music.

According to the basic probability rule, the probability of a conjunction (P(A and B)) is always less than or equal to the probabilities of its constituents (P(A) or P(B)).

Therefore, the correct answer is:

(a) The protagonist would likely develop software programs that address user-specific issues.

This option involves a single event and has a higher likelihood than the conjunction of multiple events in option (b).

99.question:
Mark wants to be able to do ten pull ups. Right now he can only do five. He wrote down a regimen and followed it. He started doing more and note pull ups. After a few months he was able to easily do ten pull ups.
Which is more likely?
(a) Mark would continue training to increase his pull-up count beyond ten.
(b) Mark would continue training to increase his pull-up count beyond ten to learn to play the guitar.
99.target_answer: (a) Mark would continue training to increase his pull-up count beyond ten
